history.content:
188 is a relatively low-workload class; I think that 170 + 186 + 188 might be doable, if that's all you're doing. 170 problem sets take time but if you put that time into them, you'll be well-prepared for exams; 188 homework and projects don't take very long, but the exams are somewhat difficult; I haven't taken 186 so can't comment but I've heard the projects take time? The balance between project/pset classes would also be useful. 

-------

Depends what you want to get out of the minor - 188 is a pretty traditional AI-centric class that imo only makes sense to take if you want to go into AI/ML/RL, otherwise it's not particularly useful. 

In terms of usefulness:

170 - Very useful for interviews, and general CS concepts

162 - Most applicable to your day-to-day work, and will give you a good project

186 - Also somewhat applicable to actual work

Data 100 - Nice intro to data science/ml without going too deep - probably a good class to take as part of your minor

In general, would suggest taking Data 100 + one-or-two of (170, 162, 186) for the most value.

188 is a relatively low-workload class; I think that 170 + 186 + 188 might be doable, if that's all you're doing. 170 problem sets take time but if you put that time into them, you'll be well-prepared for exams; 188 homework and projects don't take very long, but the exams are somewhat difficult; I haven't taken 186 so can't comment but I've heard the projects take time? The balance between project/pset classes would also be useful.

children.subject: OK, thanks that makes sense. I will likely do 170 + 186 + (100 or 188), and drop the last one if it seems like I can't juggle them.

history.content:
I'm a humanities major trying to complete the CS minor to be more competitive for SWE positions, and maybe grad school (and a little for the sense of accomplishment). I'm graduating Fall 2019 and will be over the unit cap after that, so:

I am not a strong CS student and will be working part time, so I want to be careful about the course load. I understand 162, 170, and 186 would be great for career prep, but the work load would kill me. I think I would have the best chance of success with Data 100, 186, and 188.

SO, should I take the less difficult classes or should I forget the minor and just take two out of the three (162, 170, and 186) and be better prepared for the "real world?"
history.subject: Complete Minor vs SWE career prep
